subtitle: hi this is Simon Jacobson and welcome to
meaningful Monday's where we answer your
personal questions the question this
week is I feel that I've lost myself
after a life-changing event how can I
get back to the old me how and when will
I be happy again always know that you're
not a victim of circumstances our
identities are not defined by our
experiences so true when we're
comfortable and things are going well
we're not forced we're not pressured to
rise to the occasion suddenly when
there's a trauma or a loss or any given
situation where we're thrown off course
that's when we're really tested it was
Eleanor Roosevelt that said that women
are like tea bags you don't know how
strong they are until you put them into
hot water why women i'm not sure i think
some men are that way to i guess some
men just yell that it's hot but the fact
that matter is the pressures of life
though God should preserve us all from
any undue pressures the pressures and
challenges of life is what allows us to
discover who we truly are and when a
person does get lost they have to
remember to stay the course because you
have within you all the resources you
need to deal with any given situation no
one can promise you that life is going
to be easy but you could be promised
that whatever challenge you have your
given all the resources and the
faculties and strengths to deal with
that challenge that's an unbelievable
blessing but we have to rise to the
occasion and never over identify with
your experiences you can suffer but
don't become a sufferer you can be in
pain but don't become a person of pain
and that's a critical element that
you'll see in all healthy people who
deal with challenges you'll see they
never identify it with their challenge
it's a challenge you have to deal with
it and you move on God to bless you
should bless everyone with the least
amount of pain and not allow any
suffering situation to cause any type of
debilitation or paralysis but to give
you the strength and to discover the
strength to deal with that particular
challenge and become even a greater
this has been meaningful Monday's thank
you for watching if you'd like to submit
your question please do so by clicking
on the link below everyone have a very
meaningful week
you
you
